name: Habitica Old Colors
description: A style that changes some colors/visuals/images to be similar to what they were before the sweeping site update. (Makes no/minimal changes to the layout--i.e. hiding a few things or slightly changing the presentation (a la my change to the challenge list).) Presentable but not remotely close to complete, probably, at least not in terms of my vision for it. Basically, treat this style like it's in beta until I say it's not.
additional_info: 2019/11/6: Surprise! Bet you thought you'd seen the last of me! Some fixes: A (finally!) lasting fix for the navbar text issue? Here's hoping! Made staff crown and mod star white (they don't have drop shadow on them like the name does, in part to differentiate them from emoji that might be in someone's profile name). Made the unfilled part of the progress bars on stuff like health and such white instead of seemingly-transparent. There's some bugs that have persisted (mostly because I haven't worked on this in awhile), but I don't see any new bugs having cropped up. May work on it more in December (I'm just going to be very busy November for various reasons or I'd do some work now!). 2018/9/2: Some kind of big changes, and not so big fixes: Navbar colors should be fixed for good? Wasn't the shorthand solution I wanted it to be, so I might still look, but... yeah. (The fix was so long code-wise that it's a separate rule right now despite being identical to another rule.) Fix was SUPER late and I'm sorry for that. Before I broke down and used the long-form, it actually broke AGAIN after I fixed it this past week and was testing it so I had to fix it AGAIN. DX Updated what gets hidden in the challenge listing and changed some selectors I think changed that might have un-hidden things before. New changes: - Icons for gold, gems, and hourglasses! I asked if this was okay and it is! To credit the original artists, the hourglass is by Megan (ignore the fact that the image is newer; the file has been updated but the page version is pre-redesign)... but I can't find the original artist of the other two to credit them... I'll look/ask around for that. :-/ Wanted to hide hourglasses but then you wouldn't know how many you had; might offer an option later to make it display like silver just because I think that the silver image fits better at that scale (at least icon wise, not sure about if I can easily change the location). - The icons have not made it to the market since changing them there is more confusing. For similar reasons of complexity, the images for health, experience, and mana have not changed since changing them is more involved. - The colors of the gold, gem, and hourglass text in the header have been changed to the shades for gold, gem, and silver respectively. - The colors of pop-up notifications have changed to resemble their pre-redesign shades. - Loading screen changed to dark on white instead of white on purple. - Like number turns green now if you liked the post! (Before, it was just that the "like" button changed to green.) Known issues: Still no way to make the color of the body of negative or directionless habits match the task value. I think that's it? I tried to clean up the code a tiny bit but I think I still have more to do. I did change the license of the style, which might be important, but that's it? 2018/6/13: Fixed navbar colors AGAIN. Need to find a way to make it stick, because removing the data part of the selector isn't working like it normally does, and I'm pretty sure the data part changes EVERY time the site is updated. (I also need to go through and find out which selectors are old so I can clean up the code a little.) Also made a minor edit to the background behind the HP/XP/MP bar so that it doesn't show in profiles. 2018/5/27: Fixed navbar edits that messed colors up. More edits may be incoming if I notice something off. Re-fixed Tavern sidebar colors bug. 2018/3/12: (version 0.1.1? XP) Fixed Tavern sidebar colors bug! Yay! 2018/2/14: (let's call this "version 0.1"? XD) The two additional images I uploaded to show off the style other than its main image: Challenges page Tavern with World Boss active New changes: Added contrasting border to boss bars like what's around the user progress bars in header, to coincide with next point Removed most of the dark background behind the world boss and changed its text from white to dark so it's still readable Hid rage strikes counter below world boss (These world boss edits are really kind of just me experimenting; they can be "switched off" by removing or commenting out the lines after the "boss-health-bar". You can see what the world boss display edits look like here. ) Added images to this style to make it show in search results, making it more "public" (hence the "0.1" thing I mentioned at the top of these update notes) There are still bugs and little things I'd like to change or add, but I feel comfortable about what I have here. Let me know if you find bugs I might have missed! --- 2018/1/20: New changes: Added color differentiation that existed on old site to header. Padding removed from header so avatar is flush with its edges. Added task background colors (this currently isn't something I can get to apply to negative habits or habits without either button). Hide tier 1-7 icons for now. Display name background only stops shortly after end of name now. I feel like there's something else but I can't find anything in the code that I think wasn't there before. --- 2017/12/6: List of everything this does at present: Changes the navbar and header colors to the colors of the old website Hides the "battle monsters with friends" message and the class badge Changes sync bar and message/guild notification numbers to blue instead of purple/red Changes health/mana/exp bar colors slightly to match the colors of the old website Changes the inn button to green like it was on the old website (because, hey, why not) Changes the "like" button to green instead of blue when liked Places a rounded grey background behind the now-white-text like count (this background does not turn green when you've liked a post) Changes task/reward colors to old site's colors (the body of the tasks might be changeable but it's not as easy if it's possible) Tier/name colors work as they did on the old site (white text on a grey or color background), with the same colors--the tier colors also show up where applicable on the Tavern sidebar, with one bug/exception Name backgrounds now rounded (new this update! :P) Inline code (inside two of these: `) uses the old site's colors Challenges are one to a line instead of two Hides logo and reduces indent in navbar menu Hides task column not-done count indicators Hiding the create task button was reversed because it's the only way to open new tasks in edit mode Known bugs: The mod names in the list in the sidebar of the Tavern use staff colors. I know why this is doing this (something about it is overwritten/covered up by the staff color), but not how to fix it too well yet. --- 2017/10/16: Hide task creation button now that the top-of-column options are available. Un-disable changing navbar icon button colors now that the color change works on all of them. Hide logo in header. Make challenges one to a line instead of two. Make font for gold and stuff normal weight since a recent update bolded it. --- 2017/10/14: Fix avatar-hiding code so it's not hiding col-2 things outside chat (like the avatar editor page buttons). Added indent to names so they're fully inside backgrounds in chat. --- 2017/10/11: Changes display names to their old "white on tier" coloring. Changes task value colors to their old colors. Changes header to most of its old coloring, including health bars. (But I'm not satisfied with the way it turned out; it needs work.) Changes inn button to its old green... because I could? XD Hides class icon under avatar. Hides plus or minus on habit if it doesn't apply. Hides avatars in chat and extends chat bubbles to fill full chat area. (Does not do this in PMs.) ...I think that's everything it does right now?
